titleproper.encodinganalog: Guide to the Rockwell Kent Papers

titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Rockwell Kent Papers
titlestmt.author: Columbia University Libraries. Rare Book and Manuscript Library; machine readable finding aid created by Columbia University Libraries Digital Library Program Division

publicationstmt.publisher:
Rare Book and Manuscript Library
Columbia University Libraries

profiledesc.creation: Machine readable finding aid generated from MARC-AMC source via XSLT conversion June 26, 2009

physdesc.extent: 59 linear ft (ca. 6,500 items in 44 boxes, 10 mapcase drawers, & 3 slip cases).

repository.corpname: Columbia UniversityRare Book and Manuscript Library,

did.abstract: A significant collection of Rockwell Kent's correspondence; drawings and sketches; watercolors; lithographs; proofs; manuscripts; and architectural drawings. There are also lithographs and woodblock prints by Kent's students and admirers.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note:
bioghist.p: American artist, travel writer, and political activist.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: A comprehensive collection of working drawings and sketches, watercolor paintings, lithographs, proofs, manuscripts, and architectural drawings. There are illustrations for many books including Moby Dick, Beowulf, The Canterbury Tales, The Decameron, Paul Bunyan, Candide, and The Bridge of San Luis Rey, as well as illustrations for 18 of Kent's own books; bookplates for many well known people, magazine illustrations, advertising, posters, and graphic art work of many other types. Some correspondence is included, as well as many lithographs and woodblock prints by Kent's students and admirers.

list.item: Series I: Cataloged materials: Correspondence, Manuscripts and Prints by Other Artists
Series II: Cataloged Manuacripts, Prints by others, etc.
Series III: Titled Drawings, Lithographs, Prints and Proofs
Series XII: Miscellaneous Drafts and Sketches-Early Work

acqinfo.head: Acquisition
acqinfo.p: 1971 M-1971 Berol, Mr & Mrs A.C. Gift
11/04/1996 M-96-11-04 31 letters from RK to Henry Wohltjen 6758B(Friends) Purchase
01/31/1997 M-97-01-31 6 RK letters to Art Young 2293B Purchase
02/20/1997 M-97-02-20 RK letter to Art Young 2293B Purchase

custodhist.p: Gift of Mr & Mrs Alfred C. Berol, Dan Burne Jones, & Mrs Arthur Hays Sulzberger, 1971, etc.
Gift of Charles Green & Martianne Reges, 1979.
Gift of Mr & Mrs George Spector.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of specific item; Date (if known); Rockwell Kent Papers; Box and Folder; Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Columbia University Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: 31 letters from RK to Henry Wohltjen Cataloged 11/06/1996 HR
6 RK letters to Art Young Cataloged 02/11/1997 HR
RK letter to Art Young Cataloged 02/20/1997 HR

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Single photocopies may be made for research purposes. Permission to publish material from the collection must be requested from the Curator of Manuscripts/University Archivist, Rare Book and Manuscript Library (RBML). The RBML approves permission to publish that which it physically owns; the responsibility to secure copyright permission rests with the patron.

scopecontent.p: In four boxes, numbered 1-4. Kent's letters are arranged chronologically in Boxes 2: (1918-1940); 3: (1941-1969); 4 (Letters to Richard K. Larcada, 1965-1970).

The Blue Mouse . Volume I, Nos. 1 & 2, 1906. [Unpublished]

(Manuscript text in Kent's hand with 57 pages of illustrations, including ink sketches, watercolor drawings, and pencil and pastel drawings by Kent using several pseudonyms. This was a collaborative effort of the 24-yearold Kent and his friend James Gillespie Blaine Ewing. The two produced this holograph periodical in an edition of two copies for each number. The copies were for the only subscribers: their mothers. The text is presumably a collaborative effort by Ewing and Kent and includes poems, song lyrics, short stories, a novella, and various parodies of advertisements, news stories, letters from readers, etc. This is Mrs Charles Ewing's copy. Binding: Boards, detached but present, with watercolor drawings by Kent. Modern half black morocco folding-case, spine gilt-lettered and with image of the Blue Mouse on his throne in variously colored morocco onlays
